intro: Ziziphus palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan date tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by edible, fleshy fruits resembling dates in appearance. Ziziphus palawanensis is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained soils.
